properties.name: Boston Center for the Arts - 17th Annual Queer Theater Festival - Split Britches - Miss America
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches  539 Tremont StreetSplit Britches perform Miss America at the 17th Annual Queer Theater Festival

properties.name: Joe's Pub
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches 425 Lafayette St, New York, NYKaren Finley - Free Speech Zone: Our Sympathies to Minneapolis Karen Finley will host a cabaret with the Republican convention as a backdrop for guest artists, gender benders, pundits, intellectuals, proclaimers, addicts, tramps and those with hissy fits to startle, enrage, engage and give their damn opinion.

properties.name: La Mama
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches  By popular demand and due to the fascinating new format ("Long Table" a creation of co-founder Lois Weaver) the Lesbian group Split Britches will be coming back with a VERY timely topic-the upcoming Presidential Election. Lois and co-founder Peggy Shaw have brought us this new format which proved to be a lively and evocative afternoon last Spring.

properties.name: La Mama Experimental Theatre Club
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches 74A East 4th St. NY, NY 10003

properties.name: On The Scent
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches  Have you ever been taken unawares by something in the air - transported to another place and time by an intangible but achingly familiar scent? On the Scent explores the elusive connections between smell and memory. The performance takes place in a domestic setting through which four audience members at a time are invited on intimate and aromatic journeys. Scents mingle and intertwine in the living-room, kitchen and bedroom as three distinctly different performers exude haunting, darkly humorous and seductive essences throughout the house. Limited audience capacity! Reservations: info@antifestival.com or phone +358 50 305 2005

properties.name: Royal London Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches The infamous Tammy WhyNot brings her unorthodox method of inquiry to the taboo subject of age and sex. With the help of sexual health consultants, clinical psychologists and some real live 70, 80 and 90 year old sexperts Tammy asks "What is it like to get old? What is it like to have sex? What is it like to get old and have sex?"

properties.name: Soutbank Centre Sqaure
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches  The Long Table on Performing Rights is an invitation to explore the role of performance in communicating human rights issues. The Lift, Southbank Centre Square £5

properties.name: Spoleto
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches

properties.name: The Great Hall, The People's Palace
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches  Mile End Road, E1 4NSThe Drama Department at Queen Mary is pleased to present the groundbreaking theatre group Split Britches in the UK premiere of MISS AMERICA, written and performed by Peggy Shaw and Lois Weaver. Sat 21st March at 7.30pm, Sun 22nd March at 5.30pm and Mon 23rd March at 7.30pm The Great Hall of the People’s Palace Mile End Road, London. E1 4NS £10 (£6 concessions) Free to Staff and Students of Queen Mary, University of London. Please reserve tickets by calling 020 7882 5196 or email R.Sharp@qmul.ac.uk giving your details You will be asked to pay on arrival for the performance.

properties.name: Wellcome trust
properties.description: Posted by Splitbritches 183 Euston Road, London, NW1 2BESolo Performance by Peggy Shaw, written in collaboration with Clod Ensemble Accompanied by a live band, legendary New York performance artist Peggy Shaw excavates the memories and images that shelter in her joints and unearths stories and music embedded in layers of bone and dirt. 27, 29, 30, November 2008
